preg_women.title: Pregnant women
preg_women.legend_text: Prevalence of pregnant women by district

inform.title: Vulnerability index
inform.legend_text: The INFORM model is based on risk concepts published in scientific literature and envisages three dimensions of risk: hazards & exposure, vulnerability and lack of coping capacity dimensions. See https://drmkc.jrc.ec.europa.eu/inform-index

improved_sanitation.title: Improved sanitation
improved_sanitation.legend_text: Percent of households with access to improved sanitation facilities. Source: Myanmar Population and Housing Census 2014, Department of Population, Ministry of Immigration and Population

improved_drinking_water.title: Improved drinking water
improved_drinking_water.legend_text: Percent of households with improved source of drinking water. Source: Myanmar Population and Housing Census 2014, Department of Population, Ministry of Immigration and Population

poor_quality_house.title: Poor quality housing
poor_quality_house.legend_text: Percent of households with poor quality housing. Source: Myanmar Population and Housing Census 2014, Department of Population, Ministry of Immigration and Population

multidimensional_disadvantage_index.title: Multidimensional disadvantage index
multidimensional_disadvantage_index.legend_text: The index analyzes welfare using a multidimensional approach, and focuses on examining whether people are unable to fulfil their basic needs in a variety of non-monetary dimensions. Source: Ministry of Labour, Immigration and Population and the World Bank - 2018 based on census data from 2014

age_dependency_ratio.title: Age dependency ratio
age_dependency_ratio.legend_text: Age dependency ratio is the ratio of dependents--people younger than 15 or older than 64--to the working-age population--those aged 15-64. Data are shown as the proportion of dependents per 100 working-age population. Source: Myanmar Population and Housing Census 2014, Department of Population, Ministry of Immigration and Population

wfp_risk_storms.title: Storm risk
wfp_risk_storms.legend_text: Risk indices where calculated by multiplying the vulnerability scores by the hazard score

rainfall_dekad.title: 10-day rainfall estimate (mm)
rainfall_dekad.legend_text: Estimate of precipitation over a 10-day period derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_dekad.title: 10-day rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_dekad.legend_text: 10-day precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_1month.title: Monthly rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_1month.legend_text: Monthly precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_3month.title: 3-month rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_3month.legend_text: 3-month precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_6month.title: 6-month rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_6month.legend_text: 6-month precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_9month.title: 9-month rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_9month.legend_text: 9-month precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rain_anomaly_1year.title: 1-year rainfall anomaly
rain_anomaly_1year.legend_text: 1-year precipitation anomaly compared to the long term average. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

rainfall_agg_1month.title: 1-month rainfall aggregate
rainfall_agg_1month.legend_text: Total aggregate precipitation over a 1-month period, rolling every 10 days. Derived from CHIRPS (UCSB Climate Hazards Group). https://www.chc.ucsb.edu/data/chirps

spi_1m.title: SPI - 1-month
spi_1m.legend_text: 1-month Standardized Precipitation Index calculated from dekadal CHIRPS data

spi_3m.title: SPI - 3-month
spi_3m.legend_text: 3-month Standardized Precipitation Index calculated from dekadal CHIRPS data

spi_6m.title: SPI - 6-month
spi_6m.legend_text: 6-month Standardized Precipitation Index calculated from dekadal CHIRPS data

spi_9m.title: SPI - 9-month
spi_9m.legend_text: 9-month Standardized Precipitation Index calculated from dekadal CHIRPS data

spi_1y.title: SPI - 1-year
spi_1y.legend_text: 1-year Standardized Precipitation Index calculated from dekadal CHIRPS data

days_dry.title: Days since last rain
days_dry.legend_text: Number of consecutive days with less than 2 mm precipitation in the last 30 days

streak_dry_days.title: Longest number of consecutive dry days
streak_dry_days.legend_text: Longest number of consecutive days with less than 2 mm precipitation in the last 30 days

days_heavy_rain.title: Number of days with heavy rainfall in the last 30 days
days_heavy_rain.legend_text: Total number of heavy rain days (rainfall > 75th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

days_intense_rain.title: Number of days with intense rainfall in the last 30 days
days_intense_rain.legend_text: Total number of heavy rain days (rainfall > 90th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

days_extreme_rain.title: Number of days with extreme rainfall in the last 30 days
days_extreme_rain.legend_text: Total number of heavy rain days (rainfall > 95th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

streak_heavy_rain.title: Longest consecutive number of days with heavy rainfall in the last 30 days
streak_heavy_rain.legend_text: Longest consecutive number of heavy rain days (rainfall > 75th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

streak_intense_rain.title: Longest consecutive intense rainfall days
streak_intense_rain.legend_text: Longest consecutive number of intense rain days (rainfall > 90th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

streak_extreme_rain.title: Longest consecutive extreme rainfall days
streak_extreme_rain.legend_text: Longest consecutive number of extreme rain days (rainfall > 95th percentile) within last 30 days of dekad

ndvi_dekad.title: 10-day NDVI (MODIS)
ndvi_dekad.legend_text: Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) derived from MODIS TERRA/AQUA

lst_amplitude.title: Land Surface Temperature - 10-day Amplitude (MODIS)
lst_amplitude.legend_text: Land Surface Temperature Amplitude refers to the difference between the maximum and minimum temperature in degrees Celsius

lst_daytime.title: Daytime Land Surface Temperature - 10-day (MODIS)
lst_daytime.legend_text: 10-day daytime land surface temperature derived from MODIS AQUA

lst_anomaly.title: Daytime Land Surface Temperature - 10-day Anomaly (MODIS)
lst_anomaly.legend_text: 10-day daytime land surface temperature anomaly derived from MODIS AQUA

sensitvity_flood.title: Sensitivity to floods
sensitvity_flood.legend_text: Sensitivity describes the characteristics of a community adversely affected by a flood. Sensitivity scores were assigned based on a review of the literature on climate sensitivity of livelihoods and consultation with the WFP Country Office in Myanmar

mudra_risk_river_floods.title: Population risk to river floods
mudra_risk_river_floods.legend_text: Level of population risk to river floods based on historical model (MUDRA)

mudra_risk_cyclone_winds.title: Economic risk to cyclone winds
mudra_risk_cyclone_winds.legend_text: Level of economic risk to cyclone winds based on historical model (MUDRA)

mudra_risk_cyclone_floods.title: Population risk to storm surges
mudra_risk_cyclone_floods.legend_text: Level of population risk to storm surges based on historical model (MUDRA)

annual_damage_river_floods.title: Annual damage (expected) from river floods
annual_damage_river_floods.legend_text: Expected annual damage from river floods in millions of MMK based on historical model (MUDRA)

annual_damage_cyclone_winds.title: Annual damage (expected) from strong cyclone winds
annual_damage_cyclone_winds.legend_text: Expected annual damage from strong cyclone winds in millions of MMK based on historical model (MUDRA)

sensitvity_drought.title: Sensitivity to droughts
sensitvity_drought.legend_text: Sensitivity describes the characteristics of a community adversely affected by a drought. Sensitivity scores were assigned based on a review of the literature on climate sensitivity of livelihoods and consultation with the WFP Country Office in Myanmar

poverty.title: Poverty by township
poverty.legend_text: Sensitivity scores were assigned based on a review of the literature on climate sensitivity of livelihoods and consultation with WFP Myanmar

sensitvity_storms.title: Sensitivity to storms
sensitvity_storms.legend_text: Sensitivity describes the characteristics of a community adversely affected by a storm. Sensitivity scores were assigned based on a review of the literature on climate sensitivity of livelihoods and consultation with the WFP Country Office in Myanmar

vulnerability_drought.title: Vulnerability to drought
vulnerability_drought.legend_text: Vulnerability is defined as the susceptibility or sensitivity of exposures to the impact of hazards in the absence of their capacity to cope and adapt to droughts. In this analysis, vulnerability to droughts is calculated as adpactive capcity (an output from INFORM) multiplied by the hazard sensitivity score; the product is then divded by two

vulnerability_floods.title: Vulnerability to floods
vulnerability_floods.legend_text: Vulnerability is defined as the susceptibility or sensitivity of exposures to the impact of hazards in the absence of their capacity to cope and adapt to floods. In this analysis, vulnerability to droughts is calculated as adpactive capcity (an output from INFORM) multiplied by the hazard sensitivity score; the product is then divded by two

vulnerability_storms.title: Vulnerability to storms
vulnerability_storms.legend_text: Vulnerability is defined as the susceptibility or sensitivity of exposures to the impact of hazards in the absence of their capacity to cope and adapt to storms. In this analysis, vulnerability to droughts is calculated as adpactive capcity (an output from INFORM) multiplied by the hazard sensitivity score; the product is then divded by two

wfp_risk_drought.title: Drought risk
wfp_risk_drought.legend_text: Risk indices where calculated by multiplying the vulnerability scores by the hazard score

wfp_risk_floods.title: Flood risk
wfp_risk_floods.legend_text: Risk indices where calculated by multiplying the vulnerability scores by the hazard score

population_exposed_historical_river_floo.title: Population exposed to historical river floods per year
population_exposed_historical_river_floo.legend_text: Population exposed to historical river floods per year (MUDRA)

population_exposed_historical_storm_surg.title: Population exposed to historical storm surges per year
population_exposed_historical_storm_surg.legend_text: Population exposed to historical storm surges per year (MUDRA)

adamts_buffers.title: Tropical Storms - Wind Buffers
adamts_buffers.legend_text: Wind buffers (radii) estimate potential wind speeds along the path of a storm with a buffer estimating the area exposed to each wind speed category. Source: GDACS

adamts_tracks.title: Tropical Storms - Tracks
adamts_tracks.legend_text: Tracks visualize the projected path of a storm based on the forecasted position of it's center at various points in time. Source: GDACS

hydra_s1.title: Potential flooding (Sentinel-1)
hydra_s1.legend_text: Flood water detected from Sentinel-1 data and a permanent water mask from JRC. Source: SERVIR Mekong HYDRAFloods

hydra_s2.title: Potential flooding (Sentinel-2)
hydra_s2.legend_text: Flood water detected from Sentinel-2 data and a permanent water mask from JRC. Source: SERVIR Mekong HYDRAFloods

hydra_l8.title: Potential flooding (Landsat-8)
hydra_l8.legend_text: Flood water detected from Landsat-8 data and a permanent water mask from JRC. Source: SERVIR Mekong HYDRAFloods
